es.ull.isaatc.simulation.sequential
Class Activity

java.lang.Object
  es.ull.isaatc.simulation.sequential.SimulationObject
      es.ull.isaatc.simulation.sequential.VariableStoreSimulationObject
          es.ull.isaatc.simulation.sequential.TimeStampedSimulationObject
              es.ull.isaatc.simulation.sequential.Activity
All Implemented Interfaces:
Activity, Debuggable, Describable, Identifiable, SimulationObject, VariableStore, VariableStoreSimulationObject, Prioritizable, java.lang.Comparable<SimulationObject>
Direct Known Subclasses:
FlowDrivenActivity, TimeDrivenActivity
public abstract class Activity
extends TimeStampedSimulationObject
implements Activity

A task which could be carried out by an element. An activity is characterized by its priority and a set of workgropus. Each workgroup represents a combination of resource types required for carrying out the activity.

Each activity belongs to an Activity Manager, which handles the way the activity is accessed.

An activity is potentially feasible if there is no proof that there are not enough resources to perform it. An activity is feasible if it's potentially feasible and there is at least one workgroup with enough available resources to perform the activity.

An activity can be requested by a valid element, that is, check if the activity is feasible. If the activity is not feasible, the element is added to a queue until new resources are available. If the activity is feasible, the element "carries out" the activity, that is, catches the resources needed to perform the activity. Whenever it is determined that the activity has finished, the element releases the resources previously caught.

An activity can also defined cancellation periods for each one of the resource types it uses. If an element takes a resource belonging to one of the cancellation periods of the activity, this resource can't be used during a period of time after the activity finishes.

Author:
Carlos Martín Galán

isFeasible

protected java.util.ArrayDeque<Resource> isFeasible(WorkItem wi)
Checks if this activity can be performed with any of its workgroups. Firstly checks if the activity is not potentially feasible, then goes through the workgroups looking for an appropriate one. If the activity can't be performed with any of the workgroups it's marked as not potentially feasible.

Parameters:
wi - Work Item wanting to perform the activity
Returns:
The set of resources which compound the solution. Null if there are not enough resources to carry out the activity by using this workgroup.

protected void resetFeasible()
Sets the activity as potentially feasible.

request

public abstract void request(WorkItem wItem)
Requests this activity. Checks if this activity is feasible by the specified work item. If the activity is feasible, carryOut is called; in other case, the work item is added to this activity's queue.

Parameters:
wItem - Work Item requesting this activity.
